thread.title: Rochester Twp. man charged with fleeing police, child endangerment
thread.title_full: Rochester Twp. man charged with fleeing police, child endangerment

author: Kirstin Kennedy kkennedy@timesonline.com
title: Rochester Twp. man charged with fleeing police, child endangerment
text:
0 
ROCHESTER TWP. -- A township man is facing child endangerment charges after he fled a traffic stop with a 3-year-old in his car, police said. 
Police attempted to stop Benjamin P. Eakin, 21, at 7:25 p.m. Sept. 4 at the intersection of Deer Lane Extension and Pittsburgh Road in Rochester Township. According to a police report, he accelerated "at a high rate of speed" and continued on Pittsburgh Road to avoid police. He did not stop at a stop sign and drove onto Reno Street, police said. 
Eakin continued onto Cosky Lane, kicking up gravel and dirt, then stopped at the end of the road and ran into the woods, police said, leaving the child and an adult passenger in the car. 
Eakin, of 147 Cosky Lane, has been charged by Rochester Township police with fleeing police, endangering the welfare of a child, reckless endangerment and driving with a suspended license. According to online court records, he is awaiting a Nov. 6 preliminary hearing. Tags
